result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Order for Examination (971.16)- Not Guilty by Reason of Mental Disease or Defect)
Attorney Flottmeyer advised defendant waives reading of information and enters NGI plea. Court orders evaluation. State to prepare order for evaluation. STC set. Bond cont.

3:15 PM Defendant Daniel John Schneider in court, in custody from the TC Jail.  Attorney William P Flottmeyer in court for Daniel John Schneider.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def wishes to waive right to PH. Court advised def right to PH. Def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds def KVI waives right to PH. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for further proceedings. Information filed. Atty Flottmeyer states def waives reading of information and enters NGI plea.

Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant's request to appear remotely. Defense advised had conversation with defendant prior to court. 2:18 PM  Defendant Daniel John Schneider in court, in custody from TC Jail.  Attorney William P Flottmeyer in court for Daniel John Schneider.  Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin. Report filed, not contested. Defense makes statement. State makes statement. Court advised defendant of rights to contest.  Court accepts doctor's report, finds defendant competent. Court reinstates proceedings. Defense advised appointed relative for competency. Court advised of right to counsel, SPD information provided. INIT set. Bond cont.

records.addlTxt: Competency hearing on September 28, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Order of Commitment for Treatment (Incompetency)

3:30 PM DA Sacia appears in person for the state. Defendant appears by video, in custody from the TC Jail. Attorney Flottmeyer appears in person. Defense advised attempted to discuss with defendant prior to hearing. Court advised defendant of rights to challenge. Defendant believes he is competent. Defense believes he is not competent. State calls witness, Dr. Heinz, sworn in. State examines witness. Defense examines witness. Court finds defendant incompetent based on reports and testimony. State to file order based on court's findings.

1:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel John Schneider appeared by video, in custody from the TC Jail. Jail indicates Court is able to be heard. Court can see defendant in jail cell on video, finds defendant can hear court but choosing not to talk. Defendant makes multiple statements. Court proposes reschedule. State requests to set hearing at a time can receive testimony from Doctor Heinz. Court advised will appoint an attorney to represent on standby to make sure rights are reserved and protected. CH set.
Competency hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Competency hearing on July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Cover Sheet for Confidential Records w/ Attached Report

9:10 AM Prosecuting attorney Micabil Diaz-Martinez in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Daniel John Schneider appeared by video, in custody from the TC jail. Court advised no representation. Attorney Sebion advised will reach out to jail to set up a phone call, possible competency concerns. Jail advised defendant refusing SPD representation and questioning competency. State advised received email from Lt. Koval regarding concerns. State requests competency to be addressed prior to moving forward. Attorney Sebion cannot force someone to take the representation but thinks competency needs to be addressed. Court orders competency evaluation to be completed. State to prepare order. CH set. Bond cont.
Competency hearing scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Competency hearing on June 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.
